div.h2: Ensuring all students achieve their greatest potential

div.span: January is School Board Recognition Month
Thank you for your service, Board of Education Members!

img.alt: Five people holding bundles of thank you notes smiling

div.span: Northwest Region Orchestra
Members of the Perrysburg High School orchestra and band participated in the Northwest Region Orchestra concert at Bowling Green State University.

img.alt: Large group of students smiling with some holding musical instruments

div.span: HPI Science Teacher engages in Lake Erie Research Excursion
Amy Boros was one of 15 educators chosen from more than 40 applicants to collect data alongside scientists as part of the Center for Great Lakes Literacys Lake Erie Shipboard Science Workshop.

img.alt: 22 people pose in front of a ship named Lake Guardian

div.span: Ohio Governor's Youth Art Exhibition
The Board of Education recognized Ohio Governor's Youth Art Exhibition Regional Winners
Decision Day 2019
Celebrating our graduating class and their continuing education!
Third Annual Strings on Fire Summer Lesson Program

50 students in grades 5-8 took lessons from 14 certified Perrysburg High School student teachers throughout the summer. A special thank you to Citizen Advisory Group in Perrysburg for sponsoring the Strings on Fire shirts for a third year.

img.alt: Group photo of students in matching red shirts

a.title: Cover of most recent Dashboard newsletter

img.title: Cover of most recent Dashboard newsletter
img.alt: Cover of most recent Dashboard newsletter

div.span: Perrysburg Schools will be providing breakfast and lunch to students in need every Monday through the end of the school year. Please click the following link to sign up for this service by Sunday of each week.

It appears some clarification is needed following the update we sent out yesterday. Graduation has not been canceled. There will be agraduation. It will not be like the other ceremonies that we have had in the past and Iwish this were not the case. This is not alocal decision; it is adecision that has been made for each school in Ohio. There is an order in place across the state that prevents large gatherings.

Our last communication was on Monday, April 20, in response to Governor Mike DeWines announcement that for the remainder of this school year, students will continue to go to school remotely. Since then, there has been aflurry of planning and other activities.

h3.a: Band on the Run to Award Creativity as well as Athleticism

div.span: Theres still time to join the fun with the Virtual Band on the Run 5-Whatever Challenge, the largest annual fundraiser for the Hull Prairie Intermediate School and Perrysburg Junior High School bands! Submit your entry and you will be in the running for afun award!

h3.a: Students to continue Remote Schooling for Remainder of School Year

div.span: Today, Governor Mike DeWine announced that for the remainder of the school year, students will continue to go to school remotely. This means that students will not physically return to school for the conclusion of the 2019-2020 school year but instead will continue with the current home/online learning.
As aschool district, we are preparing for different options as we do not know what agradual opening will look like for schools.We will continue to communicate with you regularly as plans solidify.

h3.a: HPI and PJHS - Remote Learning and Grading

div.span: We know that the stress put on families is tremendous and we are doing our best to determine the right path to take in the education of our students.

h3.a: Schoology - Parent Account versus Student Account

div.span: One area in Schoology we'd like to clarify is the difference between the Parent Account and Student Account.

On Thursday, April 9, during Governor Mike DeWines daily 2:00 p.m. press conference on the states COVID-19 response, the Governor responded to aquestion regarding if students will be returning to school after May 1. Gov. DeWine said hes not prepared to say when or if schools might reopen this school year.

h3.a: Band on the Run goes Virtual!

div.span: The Band on the Run 5K, the largest annual fundraiser for the Hull Prairie Intermediate School and Perrysburg Junior High School bands, that had been scheduled for May 2, 2020 has been converted to aVirtual Band on the Run 5-Whatever Challenge!
Posted: 4/8/2020

Because of Governor DeWines order to extend our school closure period, we will need amore powerful learning management system for grades K-4. As aresult, we will work to transition over the next two weeks from ClassTag to Schoology.
Posted: 4/9/2020
As Governor Mike DeWine announced earlier this week, all school facilities in the state are now required to remain closed until Friday, May 1, 2020 to slow the spread of the coronavirus COVID-19.
Posted: 4/3/2020
We have become aware of issues involving Schoology, the learning management system that Perrysburg Schools faculty and students rely on for online learning.
Posted: 4/2/2020
Perrysburg Schools will be providing breakfast and lunch to students in need every Monday through May 1, 2020.
Posted: 4/1/2020
We hope you enjoy our monthly eNewsletter, spotlighting excellence in our programs, students and employees!
Posted: 4/1/2020

span.div: The Jacket Hub app makes it easier to stay connected! Just search "Perrysburg Jacket Hub" in your App Store, iTunes or Google Play and download for your iPhone or Android device. Whether you're looking for a fellow graduate, employment opportunities or if you'd just like to keep up on news, this is your go-to app!
